com.stormpath.sdk.directory
Interface AccountStoreOptions<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Options
All Known Subinterfaces:
ApplicationCriteria, ApplicationOptions<T>, DirectoryCriteria, DirectoryOptions<T>
public interface AccountStoreOptions<T>
extends Options

Options that may be specified when retrieving Directory or Application resources.

While a Directory is expected to be an account store, an Application can be perceived as one as well: it responds to similar operations and merely delegates those operations to its associated login directories and/or groups.

Since:
0.8
See Also:
DirectoryOptions, ApplicationOptions

Method Detail

withAccounts

T withAccounts()
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated accounts are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned groups, see the withAccounts(limit) or withAccounts(limit,offset) methods.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccounts

T withAccounts(int limit)
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated accounts are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of account results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Account collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withAccounts

T withAccounts(int limit,
               int offset)
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated accounts are also retrieved in the same request (paginated) , with the first page of account results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Account collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
offset - the starting index of the first Account to retrieve in the overall Account collection's result set.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withGroups

T withGroups()
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated groups are also retrieved in the same request (paginated). This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

If you wish to control pagination parameters (offset and limit) for the returned groups, see the withGroups(limit) or withGroups(limit,offset) methods.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withGroups

T withGroups(int limit)
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated groups are also retrieved in the same request (paginated), limiting the first page of group results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Group collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withGroups

T withGroups(int limit,
             int offset)
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, its associated groups are also retrieved in the same request (paginated) , with the first page of Group results starting at the specified offset index and limiting the number of results to limit items. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Parameters:
limit - the number of results in the Group collection's first page. Min: 1, Max: 100.
offset - the starting index of the first Group to retrieve in the overall Group collection's result set.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withTenant

T withTenant()
Ensures that when retrieving the resource, the owning Tenant is also retrieved in the same request. This enhances performance by leveraging a single request to retrieve multiple related resources you know you will use.

Returns:
this instance for method chaining.
